EditorData.NodeContext: Quiet, long-suffering grunt of exasperation. The player has just missed every single effort she made to single that we're about to be ambushed - so now we're forced to fight.

Text.Value: Argh! What did you...?
Probe the halfling's thoughts.
Strike, strike, strike - before the doppelgangers do!
High Harper. May Selûne's Tears shine on this meeting.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Jaheira in party, player knows harpers are doppelgangers (revelaed through True Sight or elsehow).

Text.Value: Probe Geraldus' thoughts.
To a Harper - a signal that there are shapechangers in our midst.
Maybe not in your company, Harper. But after I gave her to Orin's blades, I promise you - she was smiling from ear to ear.
Ketheric was only the beginning. You have information on the other Chosen?
I'm sorry, Geraldus - you'll have to just say what you mean.
*Jaheira's meaning is clear: Marcus was a traitor, laying a trap. The same, it seems, is happening here.*
You have the lad a little nervous - you're the one toppled Ketheric out in the shadowlands, no?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Harper Chelvin steps up beside Geraldus, taking control of the conversation.

Text.Value: Jaheira will see through them. She must. She's fought doppelgangers before.
Argh! What did you...?
*Geraldus isn't nervous, he's terrified - and he's using 'Selûne's Tears' as some kind of code.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Geraldus darting terrified glances at Chelvin and the other Harpers

Text.Value: Doesn't she remind you of our old friend Marcus?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Turning to player - heavy with meaning, signalling that this Harper is an imposter.

Text.Value: And you are...?
DOPPELGANGERS! THEY'RE DOPPELGANGERS!
The lad's a little nervous, Jaheira. We heard of your great victory against Ketheric.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Harper Chelvin steps up beside Geraldus, taking control of the conversation.

Text.Value: Strike while Jaheira has them distracted.
NOW!
I understand, Geraldus. Take a moment.
Strike while Jaheira has them distracted.
...What?
You... are not Jaheira.

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Jaheira in not present, player doesn't know harpers are doppelgangers.

Text.Value: Geraldus is the only Harper here. The others are doppelgangers.
Clever cub. This is an ambush - strike first, while they focus on me.
*Geraldus isn't nervous, he's terrified - and he's using 'Selûne's Tears' as some kind of code.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Geraldus darting terrified glances at Chelvin and the other Harpers

Text.Value: You're a little lost. Probe Geraldus' thoughts.
You should have studied Chelvin before you stole her face. She wasn't much of a smiler.
Marcus was a cultist - what are you implying?
But not you.
You... are very observant.
What? Marcus had wings.
*Geraldus' nerves are nothing to do with Jaheira, and everything to do with the doppelgangers beside him. He's using 'Selûne's Tears' as some kind of code.*
...A very formal greeting, Geraldus. You are well?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Only the slightest hesitation - she's caught the use of the code, and is playing along.

Text.Value: Geraldus. You spoiled Orin's surprise. We'll deliver you alive for that.
...Do you know? I took her face - but she died before I could get her name.
You're a little lost. Probe Geraldus' thoughts.
I come in her stead. You can report to me.
What is the meaning of 'Selûne's Tears', Jaheira?
..The less subtle approach it is, then.
Quite right - I wonder if the Weave will melt through this lot just as easily.
High Harper. May Selûne's Tears shine on this meeting.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Hesitant, nervous - stressing the words 'Selune'sTears' as a code and hoping we understand.
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Jaheira in party, player doesn't know harpers are doppelgangers.

Text.Value: Argh - what are you doing - ?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: addressed to the player, who just distracted her by trying to read her mind

Text.Value: The problem with Marcus, of course -

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira takes a single step to the side, forcing the imposter Harper to turn with her - leaving the player an opening to strike.

Text.Value: Oh, Jaheira. Orin promised you'd make for challenging prey - but then you brought an idiot along.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sarcastically disappointed, almost pitying - Jaheira just gave us a clear signal that we missed, and the Chelvin/ doppelganger finds it hilarious.

Text.Value: Yes, Marcus. Shame such a dashing fellow turned out so evil, isn't it?
And when I deliver your corpse, she'll let me keep your skin.
Remain silent and wait for Jaheira's signal.
And you, Harper - there is something familiar about you.

EditorData.AnimationTags: OSatterley: [Reuse] HUM_F_Rig_DWS_CINE_Draw_01 (Or any of the Cine_Draw anims pender on her weapons)
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira draws her weapons (if Bronze anims ONLY)

Text.Value: I wonder what Orin plans to do with your face.
Strike while Jaheira has them distracted.
Y-yes, High Harper. Standing beneath Selûne's Tears.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Over-doing the code now, doesn't realize Jaheira gets it.

Text.Value: Strike before the doppelgangers do.
Stare at me. Study me. This Harper's face bores me - perhaps I'll steal yours next.
YES!
Argh! You little -
I... I was hoping to greet the High Harper beneath Selûne's Tears.
- we didn't end on the best of terms.
To most people, a rather old-fashioned greeting.
Can't say I know much of Gortash. But Orin is hunting you.
Probe Jaheira's thoughts for direction.
Why is he so afraid of you?

Synopsis:
Dialog with harpers in Danthelon's Dancing Axe basement ambush. A number of doppelgangers have slaughered a Harper troop and stolen their faces, forcing the one surviving Harper to set Jaheira up for an ambush.
We can see the trap coming, or pick up on Jaheira's hint that all is not right. Either way, it ends in combat.
